title: France coach Jacques Brunel has no complaints over red card in quarter-final loss but questions knock-on call in build-up to crucial Wales try
text:
France coach, Jacques Brunel, accepted the legitimacy of the red card awarded against lock, Sebastien Vahaamahina but was unhappy with the decision made by officials at the scrum six minutes from time that led to the match-winning score by Ross Moriarty.

The ball was ripped out of the scrum by Wales and appeared to go forward. Referee, Jaco Peyper, awarded a try on the field but asked for clarification from Television Match Official, Marius Jonker. The ruling went in Wales’s favour and Dan Biggar’s conversion put them in the lead for the first time in the match.

“The red card did change...
description: France coach, Jacques Brunel, accepted the legitimacy of the red card awarded against lock, Sebastien Vahaamahina but was unhappy with the decision made by officials at the scrum six minutes from time that led to the match-winning score by Ross Moriarty.
